io.nem.symbol.core.utils

Class ArrayUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.nem.symbol.core.utils.ArrayUtils

  • public class ArrayUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class that contains a handful of array helper functions.

        Creates duplicate of given array
        Parameters:
        src - The array to duplicate.
        Returns:

      • concat

        public static byte[] concat(byte[]... arrays)
        Concatenates byte arrays and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        arrays - The arrays.
        Returns:
        A single array containing all elements in all arrays.

      • split

        public static byte[][] split(byte[] bytes,
                             int splitIndex)
        Splits a single array into two arrays.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The input array.
        splitIndex - The index at which the array should be split.
        Returns:
        Two arrays split at the splitIndex. The first array will contain the first splitIndex elements. The second array will contain all trailing elements.

      • toByteArray

                                 int numBytes)
        Converts a BigInteger to a little endian byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to convert.
        numBytes - The number of bytes in the destination array.
        Returns:
        The resulting little endian byte array.

      • toBigInteger

        Converts a little endian byte array to a BigInteger.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to convert.
        Returns:
        The resulting BigInteger.

      • isEqualConstantTime

        public static int isEqualConstantTime(byte[] b,
                                      byte[] c)
        Constant-time byte[] comparison. The constant time behavior eliminates side channel attacks.
        Parameters:
        b - An array.
        c - An array.
        Returns:
        1 if b and c are equal, 0 otherwise.

      • compare

        public static int compare(byte[] b,
                          byte[] c)
        NON constant-time lexicographical byte[] comparison.
        Parameters:
        b - first of arrays to compare.
        c - second of arrays to compare.
        Returns:
        1, -1, or 0 depending on comparison result.

      • getBit

        public static int getBit(byte[] h,
                         int i)
        Gets the i'th bit of a byte array.
        Parameters:
        h - The byte array.
        i - The bit index.
        Returns:
        The value of the i'th bit in h
